AUTOTEST.ALERT: The in­ver­t­er may only be com­mis­sioned in It­aly after a suc­cess­ful Autotest (CEI 0-21). If the Autotest is not passed, no feed-in op­er­a­tion may take place. Once the Autotest is started, it must be com­pleted suc­cess­fully. The Autotest can­not be started dur­ing emer­gency power mode.
AUTOTEST.BLOCKED_MESSAGE: The state of the Autotest is block­ed at the mo­ment. Please go to the Event Log page to con­firm the er­ror.
AUTOTEST.DESCRIPTION: The Autotest can be used to check the pro­tect­ive func­tion re­quired by the Itali­an standard for mon­it­or­ing the voltage and fre­quency lim­its as well as the trip lim­its of the in­ver­t­er dur­ing com­mis­sion­ing. Dur­ing nor­mal op­er­a­tion, the in­ver­t­er con­stantly checks the cur­rent voltage and fre­quency of the grid. After starting the Autotest, vari­ous in­di­vidual tests run auto­mat­ic­ally one after the oth­er. De­pend­ing on grid con­di­tions, the dur­a­tion of the test is ap­prox. 15 minutes.
AUTOTEST.TITLE: Autotest (CEI 0-21)

BATTERIES.HINT_BACKUP_IS_ENABLED: De­let­ing the bat­tery will de­ac­tiv­ate the Full Back­up power fea­ture. Are you sure that you want to de­lete the bat­tery?
BATTERIES.HINT_BACKUP_RESERVED: Re­serve Ca­pa­city can­not be changed as val­id­a­tion range of Sup­port SoC has been vi­ol­ated. The Re­serve Ca­pa­city must be less than or equal to {{SupportSoC}}%.
BATTERIES.NO_METER_ALERT_INVALID_SETTINGS: A bat­tery can­not be con­fig­ured without a Froni­us Smart Met­er.
BATTERIES.TITLE: Bat­tery

EXCHANGE.UPDATE_REQUIRED_DESCRIPTION: Please up­date the firm­ware of your in­ver­t­er

FACTORY_RESET.INFO_PARAMETERS_CUSTOMER: The factory reset will reset gen­er­al and en­er­gy man­age­ment set­tings.
FACTORY_RESET.INFO_PARAMETERS_TECHNICIAN: The factory reset will reset gen­er­al, en­er­gy man­age­ment, device con­fig­ur­a­tion, safety and grid reg­u­la­tion set­tings.

IOMAPPING.BACKUP_ERROR_HINT_METER_BATTERY: Bat­tery and Smart Met­er are needed for Full Back­up con­fig­ur­a­tion. Please set up bat­tery and Smart Met­er in the device con­fig­ur­a­tion menu and make sure that the Smart Met­er is con­nec­ted at the feed-in point.
IOMAPPING.BACKUP_INFO_HINT_RSD: At­ten­tion: Con­tinu­ing the con­fig­ur­a­tion of the back-up fea­ture will de­ac­tiv­ate trigger of Rap­id Shut­down by loss of AC. If you want to use the Rap­id Shut­down fea­ture, we re­com­mend us­ing the Wired Shut­down Pins (WSD) on the pilot. Fur­ther in­form­a­tion can be found in the Op­er­at­ing In­struc­tions.
IOMAPPING.OPTIONS_SYSTEMDEADLOCKPREVENTION_ERROR: An er­ror oc­cur­red while cal­cu­lat­ing the lim­it for the back­up re­serve ca­pa­city.

MODBUS.CUSTOMER_INFORMATION: De­ac­tiv­at­ing the Mod­bus in­ter­face can af­fect ex­tern­al en­er­gy man­age­ment. Loc­al con­trol by a grid op­er­ator or elec­tri­city re­tailer may also be af­fected.
MODBUS.INTERFACE_TCP: Con­trol sec­ond­ary in­ver­t­er via Mod­bus TCP
MODBUS.INTERFACE_TCP_DISABLED: Not pos­sible be­cause a Mod­bus in­ter­face is in slave mode.
MODBUS.INTERFACE_TCP_READ_ONLY: The 7xx mod­els of the Sun­Spec Mod­bus com­mu­nic­a­tion via TCP/IP are read only.

ETH.CAPTION: Eth­ernet (LAN1)
ETH.HINTRECONNECT_DYNAMICIP: Re­con­nect with the mon­it­or­ing sys­tem now. The mon­it­or­ing sys­tem is avail­able un­der the host­name '{{hostname}}' in the con­fig­ured net­work. If your router does not sup­port name res­ol­u­tion, please search for the as­signed IP ad­dress via your router in­ter­face or con­tact your net­work ad­min­is­trator.
ETH.HINTRECONNECT_STATICIP: Re­con­nect with the mon­it­or­ing sys­tem now. The mon­it­or­ing sys­tem is avail­able un­der the stat­ic ad­dress '{{ipAddress}}' in the con­fig­ured net­work.

MULTINETWORK.HINTDISCONNECT: When re­con­fig­ur­ing the net­work, the cur­rent con­nec­tion to the mon­it­or­ing sys­tem will be closed.
MULTINETWORK.HINTDISCONNECT_AP:
When ap­ply­ing the net­work set­ting, the cur­rent con­nec­tion may be in­ter­rupted.
In this case, con­nect your Smart Device to the in­verter­'s ac­cess point again.
MULTINETWORK.HINT_DISCONNECTED_1: The cur­rent con­nec­tion to the mon­it­or­ing sys­tem has been closed.
MULTINETWORK.HINT_NO_INTERFACE_CONNECTED: Please con­nect your in­ver­t­er via {{ETHERNET}} or {{WIFI}} to the In­ternet to en­sure the cor­rect on­line func­tion­al­ity of the device.

SOLARWEB.CAPTION: Sol­ar.web

SOLARWEB.LICENSING_MISSING_CONNECTION: Without con­nec­tion to Sol­ar.web, on­line li­censing is not pos­sible.

UAP.CAPTION: Ac­cess point
UAP.ERROR_UAPPSK_FAILURE: Con­nec­tion is not pos­sible with this net­work key

MULTINETWORK.UAP_HINTRECONNECT: The con­fig­ured net­work {{ssid}} is now act­ive. The mon­it­or­ing sys­tem is avail­able un­der {{link}} in this net­work.

WLAN.CAPTION: WLAN
WLAN.HINTRECONNECT_DYNAMICIP: Re­con­nect with the mon­it­or­ing sys­tem now. First, switch to the WLAN '{{ssid}}'. The mon­it­or­ing sys­tem is avail­able un­der the name '{{hostname}}' in this net­work. If your router does not sup­port name res­ol­u­tion, find your IP ad­dress via the router in­ter­face or con­tact your net­work ad­min­is­trator.
WLAN.HINTRECONNECT_STATICIP: Re­con­nect with the mon­it­or­ing sys­tem now. First, switch to the WLAN '{{ssid}}'. The mon­it­or­ing sys­tem is avail­able un­der the stat­ic ad­dress '{{ipAddress}}' in this net­work.
WLAN.HINT_WIFI_SECURITY_UNSUPPORTED_CONTENT: Se­cur­ity type of net­work {{ssid}} not sup­ported
WLAN.WPS_DISCONNECTED_2: If not done yet, please ac­tiv­ate the WPS func­tion on your WLAN router. The con­nec­tion buildup can take sev­er­al minutes.
WLAN.WPS_DISCONNECTED_3: Please con­nect your device (com­puter, tablet, smart­phone, etc.) to the wire­less net­work in which the WPS func­tion was started.
WLAN.WPS_DISCONNECTED_4: Please open the setup wiz­ard again by us­ing the IP ad­dress that your router as­signed to the sys­tem. If you have prob­lems re­con­nect­ing to your sys­tem mon­it­or­ing, the Froni­us Sol­ar.start app can help you.
WLAN.WPS_ERROR_OVERLAP: Mul­tiple WPS routers are with­in range. No con­nec­tion is pos­sible.
WLAN.WPS_ERROR_TIMEOUT: Con­nec­tion timeout ex­ceeded. No WPS router was de­tec­ted in the giv­en time.
WLAN.WPS_HINTDISCONNECT: After starting WPS, any act­ive WLAN con­nec­tion to the mon­it­or­ing site will be closed.
WLAN.WPS_PROBLEM_HINT_1: If you have con­nec­tion prob­lems, check the com­mu­nic­a­tion LED on your in­ver­t­er. If it is red, it was not pos­sible to con­nect to the net­work via the WPS.
WLAN.WPS_PROBLEM_HINT_2: Try to re­start the WPS func­tion of your router.
WLAN.WPS_PROBLEM_HINT_3: If this is not pos­sible, ac­tiv­ate the WLAN ac­cess point on the in­ver­t­er to re­con­nect. Try au­then­tic­a­tion with the WLAN pass­word if the WPS au­then­tic­a­tion fails.
WLAN.WPS_START_HINT_1: Please ac­tiv­ate the WPS func­tion on your router now and then press "Start".

MULTINETWORK.WLANNOTINRANGE: Con­nec­tion to the se­lec­ted net­work has failed. Is this net­work ac­cess­ible?

PAGE.SAVED_SUCCESSFUL: The set­tings have been saved suc­cess­fully.
PAGE.SAVE_FAILED: The set­tings could not be saved.

POLICY.CUSTOMER_CANT_DECLINE_POLICY_BECAUSE_OF_: Cloud Con­trol Tech­ni­cian Pro­file re­quires policy to be ac­cepted. Oth­er­wise the In­ver­t­er can­not be con­trolled by the grid provider.
POLICY.TERMS_AND_CONDITIONS_PREFIX: When the in­ver­t­er and the devices con­nec­ted to it are con­nec­ted to the In­ternet, cer­tain device data (the unique iden­ti­fier of the in­ver­t­er, the IP ad­dress of the device, the time stamp as well as the con­fig­ur­a­tion set­tings, ser­vice mes­sages/status codes) are auto­mat­ic­ally sent to us, Froni­us In­ter­na­tion­al GmbH, Froni­usstraße 1, 4643 Petten­bach, Aus­tria, phone +43 (0) 72 42 241-0, e-mail: {{emailLink}} .
POLICY.TERMS_AND_CONDITIONS_SUFFIX: We store this data in or­der to identi­fy the devices for Froni­us ser­vices via Sol­ar.web, to de­term­ine the op­er­at­ing status of the devices, to en­sure trouble-free ser­vice and op­er­a­tion­al re­li­ab­il­ity of the devices and to be able to ward off un­au­thor­ized at­tacks. The read­ing and stor­age of the device data is ne­ces­sary in or­der to be able to provide these ser­vices for the in­ver­t­er ser­vice you have re­quested and the as­so­ci­ated devices. We only es­tab­lish a con­nec­tion to the per­son of the user with this device data in the case of a spe­cif­ic ser­vice re­quested by you. I ac­know­ledge that Froni­us will then not provide cer­tain ser­vices due to lack of au­thor­iz­a­tion of the in­ver­t­er and as­so­ci­ated devices, and that func­tions that de­pend on Sol­ar.web can­not be used.

POWERMETER.ADDRESS_ALREADY_IN_USE: An­oth­er Smart Met­er is con­fig­ured with this ad­dress.
POWERMETER.HINT_BACKUP_ENABLED: De­let­ing the Smart Met­er will also de­ac­tiv­ate the bat­tery as well as the Back­up Power fea­ture. Are you sure that you want to de­lete the Smart Met­er?
POWERMETER.TITLE: Power Met­er

PV_GENERATOR.ERROR_ENABLED_TOO_LESS: At least one PV in­put has to be ac­tiv­ated
PV_GENERATOR.FIXED_VALIDATION_EMPTY_FIELD: This field must not be empty.
PV_GENERATOR.TITLE: PV Gen­er­ator

REMOTE_ACCESS.DESCRIPTION: The re­mote ac­cess al­lows ac­cess to your in­ver­t­er via a se­cure con­nec­tion (Froni­us Tech­nical Sup­port only). Dia­gnost­ic data is trans­mit­ted, which can provide valu­able in­form­a­tion for troubleshoot­ing. Please only ac­tiv­ate re­mote main­ten­ance ac­cess if you have pre­vi­ously con­tac­ted Froni­us and are re­quested to do so by Froni­us Tech­nical Sup­port.
REMOTE_ACCESS.TITLE: Re­mote Ac­cess

REMOTE_CONFIG.HINT: If this set­ting is de­ac­tiv­ated, it will not be pos­sible to change para­met­ers re­motely. This fea­ture can only be re­act­iv­ated loc­ally on the device!
REMOTE_CONFIG.TOGGLE: Al­low con­fig­ur­a­tion of the in­ver­t­er via Sol­ar.web

SELECT_NET_TYPE.SELECT_NET_TYPE_INPUT_VAL_REQUIRED: This field should not be empty

SETUP.NO_SETUP_SELECTED: No coun­try setup has been se­lec­ted. Please re­start the com­mis­sion­ing wiz­ard and run the product setup.
SETUP.TITLE: Coun­try Setup

OHMPILOT_ECO_HINT_AUTO: Sup­port-SoC can not be ac­tiv­ated. The auto con­fig­ur­a­tion Sup­port-SoC is out­side a valid con­fig­ured op­er­at­ing bat­tery SoC range.
OHMPILOT_ECO_HINT_MANUAL: Sup­port-SoC can not be ac­tiv­ated due to in­com­pat­ible SoC-Lim­its. At least {{supportSocHysteresisMin}}% needs to be provided as hys­ter­esis be­low SoC-Max. If back­up power is con­fig­ured (PV-Point, Full Back­up), the value must be high­er than the re­serve ca­pa­city.

SOLARWEB.ALERT_SETTINGS_SAVED_SUCCESSFUL: The set­tings have been saved suc­cess­fully.
SOLARWEB.AT_LEAST_ONE_REMOTE_CONTROL_PROFILE: At least one Cloud Con­trol Pro­file has to be act­ive to en­able Cloud Con­trol
SOLARWEB.CANT_ACTIVATE_REMOTE_CONTROL_WITHOUT_POL: Cloud Con­trol re­quires ac­cepted policy to al­low send data to Sol­ar.web
SOLARWEB.CUSTOMER_CANNOT_TURN_OFF_TECHNICIAN_REMO: Tech­ni­cian per­mis­sions are re­quired to turn off Cloud Con­trol
SOLARWEB.ENABLED_REMOTE_CONTROL_REQUIRED_FOR_ANY_: Cloud Con­trol has to be act­ive to use Cloud Con­trol Pro­files
SOLARWEB.ENABLED_REMOTE_CONTROL_REQUIRED_FOR_YOUR: Cloud Con­trol is re­quired in your coun­try and can there­fore not be de­ac­tiv­ated
SOLARWEB.REDIRECT_POLICY_SETTINGS_QUESTION: To use Cloud Con­trol, the policy has to be ac­cepted. Go to policy set­tings now?
SOLARWEB.REMOTE_CONTROL_MANDATORY_HINT: If cloud con­trol (re­mote con­trol via cloud) is man­dated by the grid op­er­ator or needed by a user au­thor­ized by you (e.g. op­er­ator of a vir­tu­al power plant), con­sent to the ter­ms and con­di­tions is re­quired. A con­trolling user is dis­played in Sol­ar.web.
SOLARWEB.REMOTE_CONTROL_PRIORITY_HINT: Cloud con­trol com­mands al­ways take pre­ced­ence over loc­al con­trol com­mands.
SOLARWEB.SEND_DATA_HINT: Send archive data to Froni­us Sol­ar.web

SOLAR_API.INFO_GENERAL: The Sol­ar API is an Eth­ernet-based, open JSON in­ter­face. If en­abled, IOT devices in the loc­al net­work may ac­cess in­ver­t­er in­form­a­tion without au­then­tic­a­tion. For se­cur­ity reas­ons the in­ter­face is dis­abled by de­fault and should not be en­abled if it is not re­quired for a 3rd party ap­plic­a­tion (e.g. EV charger, smart home solu­tions, etc.).
SOLAR_API.INFO_SOLARWEB: For mon­it­or­ing Froni­us re­com­mends to use Sol­ar.weblaunch in­stead, which provides se­cure ac­cess to in­ver­t­er status and pro­duc­tion in­form­a­tion.

STARTPAGE.NETWORK_HINT: Net­work needs to be con­fig­ured and Ter­ms & Con­di­tions need to be ac­cepted.
STARTPAGE.POLICYTERMS_HINT: Ter­ms & Con­di­tions have to be ac­cepted.
STARTPAGE.SOLARWEB_WIZARD_QUESTION: To start the Sol­ar.web wiz­ard, an In­ternet con­nec­tion is re­quired. Are you sure your device (laptop, smart­phone, tablet) is con­nec­ted to the In­ternet?
STARTPAGE.SOLARWEB_WIZARD_QUESTION_RETRY: An In­ternet con­nec­tion could still not be found. Do you want to try again?
STARTPAGE.STARTSOLARWEB_NOTE_NETWORK_MANDATORY: Net­work con­fig­ur­a­tion has to be fin­ished first

SUPPORT_FILE.GENERATED: The sup­port in­form­a­tion has been suc­cess­fully cre­ated and is ready for down­load.
SUPPORT_FILE.GENERATE_FAILED: An er­ror oc­cur­red while cre­at­ing the sup­port in­form­a­tion!
SUPPORT_FILE.GENERATING: Pre­par­ing the sup­port in­form­a­tion. This may take a few minutes.
SUPPORT_FILE.TITLE: Sup­port info

SUPPORT_USER.TERMINATE_SUPPORT_USER_SUCCESS: The Sup­port User Ses­sion was suc­cess­fully ter­min­ated.
SUPPORT_USER.TITLE: Sup­port User

SYSTEMOVERVIEW.NO_PV_OR_BATT: At least a PV gen­er­ator or a bat­tery com­pon­ent must be ad­ded.

TIMEPICKER.HINT: * use ar­rows (⇅) to change the time

WIZARD.HEADLINE: Setup
WIZARD.PRODUCT_ACTIVATION_FAILED: An er­ror oc­cur­red while gen­er­at­ing the li­cense. Please make sure that the seri­al num­ber and the Vcode entered match the rat­ing plate of the in­ver­t­er. Please re­start the Ser­vice Wiz­ard again af­ter­wards. If the prob­lem per­sists, please con­tact Froni­us Tech­nical Sup­port.
